dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many of us probably couldn’t identify this work of art, b there’s one person who definitely doesn’t have a clue wha even is, and that is... ... JESSE, who steps into the shot, his back to us. He lo at it, his head tilting a little left, a little right. Af a moment of silent contemplation...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Yo, I thought I was gonna see some, like, vaginas. He tells this to a YOUNG WOMAN, who steps into frame next him. A familiar silhouette against the lighted artwork, a we soon reveal this is... JANE. Yes, Jesse’s beautiful, dear, lost... dead Jane. Telling us this is another FLASHBACK, sometime after thei planned Santa Fe visit in Episode #209, but before their downward drug spiral of #211.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I didn’t say she actually painted vaginas. I said some of her paintings looked like vaginas.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (re: this painting) Uh, seriously? Not even close. Jane smiles at his playfulness. He’s just bored and wants get under her skin. But Jane still makes an effort to educate him, whispering respectfully in the museum...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Georgia O'Keeffe painted all kinds of stuff. Everyday items. Her surroundings. Some of it evoked an... erotic nature. It’s who she was. Jesse squints at the square black hole in the painting. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 2.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Not like any vagina I ever saw. (then) This chick have medical issues?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: This particular painting is of a door. Jane pads off, leaving Jesse to stare at the abstract por He frowns, not convinced at all...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Any other doors here we can check out? Like, real ones, or...? INT. JESSE’S TERCEL - DAY - LATER The couple climb into Jesse’s Tercel, a lit CIGARETTE in Jane’s mouth. Jesse is still a little dumbfounded, holdin his keys in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Y'know, I-I-I don’t get it. Why would anyone paint a picture of a door? Over and over again, like dozens of times?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: But it wasn’t the same...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. It was.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: It was the same subject, but it was different every time. The light was different, her mood was different. She saw something new each time she painted it. Jesse’s not buying into this artsy-fartsy bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: And that’s not psycho to you.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Well, then... why should we do anything more than once? Should I just smoke this one cigarette? Maybe we should only have sex once if it’s the same thing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 3.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: This gets Jesse’s attention... Don't go down that road.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Whoa. No...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Should we just watch one sunset? Or live just one day? (her point) Because it’s new every time. Each time it’s a different experience. Jesse can’t argue with that -- but something is still rub him wrong about the whole thing. And besides, he’s having too much fun razzing her over this.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Okay, fine. I guess the cow skull pictures were cool, but... a DOOR? I will say it again. A door. ZZZZZZZZLZZLZAZLZZZ «we Jesse lets out a fake SNORE, but he still doesn’t get und her skin.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Why not a door? Sometimes you get fixated on something, and you might not even get why. You open yourself up and go with the flow... wherever the universe takes you. Jesse sighs, he’s not going to win this one. He puts his keys in the ignition and starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Okay, so... the universe took her to a door. She got all obsessed with it and just had to paint it twenty times until it was perfect. Jane shakes her head -- not quite.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: No. I wouldn’t say that. Nothing’s perfect. Jesse studies her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, I mean... Some things. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 4.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Meaning her. Romantic Jesse shifts over and gives her a kiss. Jane intentionally (playfully) doesn’t lean in to m it easier for him to reach. She smiles as he moves back.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: That was so sweet, I think I threw up in my mouth a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (laughs ) You can’t admit just for once that I'm right?! C’mon. That O'Keeffe lady kept trying over and over until that stupid door was perfect. Jane smokes her cigarette -- shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: No. That door... was her home, and she loved it. To me, that’s about making that feeling last. Jesse watches Jane take a final satisfying drag on her cigarette, the filter stained with lipstick, and... An ECU of the CIGARETTE being extinguished in Jesse’s ful ashtray. A remnant which we found last episode in #310, f a moment Jesse wishes would have gone on forever.

dialogues.speaker: END TEASER
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF FEET. Wearing hospital booties, lowering toward the ground with a motorized HUMMMMMMM. The feet belong to HANK. He is strapped into something called an Electromechanical Patient Lifter, which has him in a diap like harness attached to motorized cables that raise and lower him. A PHYSICAL THERAPIST guides him between a set PARALLEL BARS. (This area should be filled with as much h end physical therapy equipment as we can get, probably in big redressed Waiting Room).

dialogues.speaker: PHYSICAL THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Okay, alright. Here we go. You ready? Sweat drips off Hank’s forehead as the weight shifts -- h feet touch the ground, but only his arm strength is supporting him. He’s clearly having trouble, his breathin is labored... his legs have no power; little movement. MARIE, SKYLER and WALTER JR. are here for moral support, to the side. Full of hope that he can do this, but... The pain is too much. He wants to stop.

dialogues.speaker: PHYSICAL THERAPIST
dialogues.text: C’mon, gimme a step. Gimme one step.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: (struggling) Nope. Nope. That’s it. Take me up.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: You can do this, Hank. (then) C'mon, it’s supposed to hurt. Pain is weakness leaving your body--

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Pain is my foot in your ass, Marie. Marie is a bit of a drill instructor here, and doesn’t mi the abuse. Giving as good as she gets...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Hey, if you can get your leg up that high, I say go for it! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 6.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hank’s arms shake. He’s falling. He can’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Take me up, take me up! HUMMMMMMMM. The therapist slowly raises Hank back up, so feet are dangling a little. Marie remains strong, not giv away any hint of disappointment. But Skyler gives her son comforting rub on the back, knowing how important Uncle H is to Junior. The therapist remains positive...

dialogues.speaker: PHYSICAL THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Alright, coffee break. We're gonna let you rest for a minute, then we're gonna try it again.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Never mind about your “coffee break.” Take me up. I’m done.

dialogues.speaker: PHYSICAL THERAPIST
dialogues.text: We'll just pick up where we left off. Hank sees the concern and subtle pity on Sky and Junior's faces. It riles him even more. He looks at his wife... But Walt Jr. tries to encourage and urge him on... WALTER, JR. C'mon, Uncle Hank. You can do it. How else are you gonna get out of here? But something about this pisses Hank off even more. He lo in on Junior and snaps...

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Don’t you have any friends? I mean, Jesus. Find something better to do! I don’t need everyone staring at me hangin’ here like a camel’s ball sac. Hank is a little mean and petty, but Junior isn’t hurt. H understands (going all the way back to the Pilot when it awkward for him just to try on new pants).

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Hank, he just wants to be supportive-- But Walt Jr. softly interrupts his mom and aunt... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 7.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER, JR.
dialogues.text: It’s alright. Walt Jr. moves toward the exit. Both Skyler and Marie suppress the urge to lay into Hank, seeing him hanging th in his debilitated state. Hank knows he was out of line t and part of him is sorry, but another part just doesn’t g a shit.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: I'll be right back, okay? Skyler and Marie quietly follow after Junior. As they’re leaving...

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: (to therapist) Gonna get me out of here sometime today? INT. HOSPITAL —- HALLWAY - DAY - CONTINUOUS Skyler turns back as hesitant Marie brings up what is, fo her, a delicate subject.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Sky? We got our first bill. And, you know, if you’re still insistent...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: I am. Skyler holds out a hand -- let's have it. Marie reluctant produces a folded piece of paper, hands it over. It’s Han HOSPITAL/THERAPY BILL.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Prepare yourself. Skyler unfolds the bill and locates the “Amount Due”. We don’t see the total, but judging from Skyler’s reaction (underplayed for her sister’s benefit), it’s pretty damn

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: They're gonna start coming in weekly like that, so... (then) You're sure you can do this? Remember, this is the lie of “gambling winnings” Skyler t her sister in #309. It’s Skyler’s plan to take Walt’s dir drug money and use it for good. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 8.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Yeah... Skyler nods... but not a confident one, as the enormity o the situation hits her. Off her well-faked smile... AN ABSTRACT IMAGE. A wavy SEA OF BLUE. We are in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking straight up through a wavy, solid sheet of BLUE METH. It may take a beat to figure out where we are, but once Jesse’s FACE appears in his Tyvek suit, we'll probably know. He looks down through the “glass,” right at us, examining fine workmanship. After a few beats of us feeling like pe fish in his aquarium... Jesse raises a SCRAPER TOOL, and using the butt of it... SMASH!!! Meth spiders out into beautiful broken aqua shar SMASH-SMASH-SMASH as he then breaks it smaller and smalle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse transfers the product into the usual Rubbermaid... as he works, he gets an odd feeling. He turns to see... WALT -- watching him closely. Very closely. Creepy, like Walt’s either going to kiss him or kill him. Okay... Jesse goes back to his task. He seals the lid and moves t LAST of FIVE BINS to the weigh station, but immediately, steps in.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: I’1l do that.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What the hell, man? Jesse steps back, watching Walt zero out the scale and calculate the weight.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What, I can’t work a scale now? But Walt says nothing, recording the weight onto a chart. Jesse slow-burns, wanting to know what the deal is... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 9.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: This is bullshit. Just say it. Just say the words. You think I’m stealing?! Walt holds a finger to his lips -- shhhh. He motions arou to the rafters, as if to say, “Bugs. They (Gus and compan might be listening. Don’t use that word.” Walt returns hi attention back to the clipboard. Jesse just shakes his head, full of mock outrage. Of cour we know he’s stealing, but how dare this motherfucker acc him! Off of riled Jesse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing. Where Jesse attends his drug counselling. A yes, this maybe could be DUSK.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP LEADER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: “Walk with who you are.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse slips into a session already in progress. An averag sized group, including BADGER and SKINNY PETE, in their r circle setting, listen to words of encouragement from the GROUP LEADER (last seen in #309).

dialogues.speaker: GROUP LEADER
dialogues.text: That was the phrase my sponsor used with me, back when I first started coming to meetings. (scans faces) It’s probably just a different way of saying, “Be yourself.” Right? But this idea of “walk” also tells me that I have to move forward. Badger and Skinny Pete actually seem to be into this mess Listening carefully and nodding to these words of persona motivation. Are they just playing along? We’re not sure.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP LEADER
dialogues.text: Always good advice, at least for me. (scans group) I see we have some new people here at Group. Couple of new faces. See some hands? First time? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 10.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Four hands go up around the circle, hesitant and unsure, their first experience in group. One new girl, ANDREA (ea 20's, Latina) is the last to reluctantly raise her hand.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP LEADER
dialogues.text: Great. Welcome. Maybe we can go around, introduce ourselves. Say whatever’s on your mind. (points) How about you? You want to start us off... He points to Andrea -- pretty, alone, fragile. Jesse take note of her when she’s called upon. She’s uncomfortable w all these new eyes on her, but she also has a toughness t finally gets her to, “Fuck it, I'll just do this...”

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Yeah. My name is Andrea... and uh... Not really sure what else to say, she gives a brief shrug her shoulder. The Group Leader remains positive...

dialogues.speaker: GROUP LEADER
dialogues.text: We don’t bite. No judgements. You can be as open and honest as you want to be.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Honestly. .? (then) I don’t want to be here. She’s not being bitchy, or a hard-ass. It’s simply that h asked, and she answered.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP LEADER
dialogues.text: Alright, fair enough. Who else had their hand up? As our group leader continues on, unruffled, we hold on Jesse. Off him, eyeing Andrea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON doughnuts being picked over. It’s after the meeting, and group members gather around the free coffee snacks at a side table. Badger loads up as Jesse approach him and Skinny Pete, pretending not to know them (as “cov in their meth selling ruse). (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 11.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Hey. ‘Sup. My name’s Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: BADGER
dialogues.text: Well... hello, Jesse. My name is Brandon. And this is, I believe... Peter?

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY PETE
dialogues.text: Right. I’m Peter. How are you? Jesse rolls his eyes at their suck-ass acting. He looks around, walking them out of earshot of the rest of the gr

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I just, uh, wanted to give you a heads up. It’s gonna get a little slower smuggling product with, uh, Grandpa Anus watching every move I make. (assures them) Don’t worry. I’11l keep it flowing. Badger and Skinny Pete don’t show relief or enthusiasm ov this news, just an awkward sideways glance.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY PETE
dialogues.text: (faking it) Great... Right on.

dialogues.speaker: BADGER
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (glances around) So, uh... how’zit selling? Mad volume? The guys look at each other and kind of nod, slowly worki their way down to...

dialogues.speaker: BADGER
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s uh... you know, uh... (finally) It’s not so good. it’s

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What do you mean? you sold? How much have

dialogues.speaker: BADGER
dialogues.text: I sold a teenth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 12.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: One teenth?! That’s it? (glances around at group) To who? Badger points meekly to Skinny Pete.

dialogues.speaker: BADGER
dialogues.text: To him. Pete shrugs sheepishly, gives a little “Yo”-type nod and wave. Jesse is stunned -- you've gotta be fucking kidding

dialogues.speaker: BADGER
dialogues.text: Look, it’s not so easy selling to these people. They’re here tryin’ to better themselves.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY PETE
dialogues.text: Yeah, there’s like... positivity and stuff goin’ on here. Jesse is outraged. He wants to bust a gasket and yell, bu he can’t do it here. Instead, quietly:

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I’m out risking my ass to get product for you two, and you’re too pussy to sell?! You’re pathetic. (fuming) Y'know what? I want it back. All of it. I’11 sell it myself!

dialogues.speaker: BADGER
dialogues.text: C'mon, man. Don’t be like that. Selling to these people... It’s like shooting a baby in the face. It’s not natural.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY PETE
dialogues.text: Yeah, Jesse. It’s not so easy like you think.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I will show you exactly how easy it is... Jesse turns and looks around the room, until his eyes lan on... ANDREA -- who is having her court card signed by the Grou Leader. He’s giving some last words of advice to a few of the newbies -- stick with this, it's worth trying. But Andrea is waiting to get her card back and split. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 13.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse gives a last look back to his worthless salesmen, a starts heading toward the exit. Just as... Andrea gets her signed card back, also making her way tow the door. Jesse watches her as she moves -- a lion tracking the wea prey in the herd. Jesse times his arrival at the door just ahead of Andrea. About to exit, he pauses and smiles, moving as if to say, “Ladies first.”

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Oh, hey. Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: No. Go ahead. But Jesse doesn’t go -- he’s much too sensitive a guy to ahead of a woman. Smooth, sweet, and to us... just evil.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Andrea, right?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Hey. Um, my name’s Jesse, and, uh... (private -- for them only) I don’t really want to be here either. (beat) Oh, uh... Sorry... Off Andrea, heartened to meet someone who thinks like she does, and no idea of what awaits her...

dialogues.speaker: END ACT ONE
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 14.

dialogues.speaker: ACT TWO
dialogues.text: BLACKNESS. An unknown RUMBLE sound, muffled, like we’re underwater. And it turns out, yes, we are underwater, as lid comes off a metal pot -- we’re LOOKING UP from the bo through boiling water. Not in the Super Lab, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skyler moves into view above us, her face looking down as salts the water. After a beat, she dumps in a fistful of pasta -- SPLOOSH! WIDER -- out of our specialty shot -- we see Skyler also a pot of sauce and meatballs bubbling, a bowl of salad, a loaf of Italian bread on a cutting board. She cranks a cooking timer as through the main room walks... ... Walter Jr. He eyes the dining room table, seeing ther THREE PLACE SETTINGS. WALTER, JR. Aunt Marie’s coming to dinner? Skyler wipes her hands with a towel, answering with caref measured nonchalance:

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: No. Your Dad is. Really? Off Junior, smiling at this unexpected surprise..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hours later. Empty sauce-smeared plates tell us that dinner is well over, as we find Walt in his old chair wit baby Holly cradled against his body. WALTER, JR. (playfully) How'd you get her to sleep so quick? Are you that boring?

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: I'm “comforting.” I’m a comforting presence. As Walt rises to place sleeping Holly in her nearby bassi he shoots a smile to Skyler, who sits nursing a glass of wine. Sky is politely noncommittal. Just... even. But if we're judging by Junior’s mood, the meal went well. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 15.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Walt, Jr. reaches in his wallet, pulls out his INSTRUCTIO PERMIT from the New Mexico DMV and holds it up for his fo to see (we do NOT need to show it particularly well -- we especially DON’T want to make out the date and year). WALTER, JR. Hey, so check it out. See what this means? Check out the date. Next Thursday is officially six months that I’ve had my learner's. Which means... (hooray!) «+. I can get my provisional and start driving by myself.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: (returning to the table) Since when? You don’t turn sixteen for two more months. WALTER, JR. Doesn’t matter -- it’s a provisional. Look it up! They changed the law like, ten years ago. Walt looks to Skyler -- you onboard with this? She alread knew, and shrugs -- yep.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Well, I didn’t vote for that. WALTER, JR. Doesn’t matter if you voted for it. It’s the law. (again playful) So both of you start thinking about what kinda car you wanna buy me.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Mmm. WALTER, JR. I think I’d be good with either an old IROC or a ‘Stang.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Ah. A “'Stang,” mm-hmm?

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: How about something with playing cards in the spokes? Makes a nice motor-y sound. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 16.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: This is refreshing -- Mom and Dad together goofing around with Junior. It’s been a long time since we’ve seen that. Walter, Jr.'s been kinda starved for it, in fact. Grinnin WALTER, JR. Ha, ha dad. You're not going to get off that easy. Alas, all good things end. At this lull in the conversati

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Well, I think this is um... we should probably table this discussion for later. Your Dad and I have a couple things to talk about, so... Junior sighs. He gets up, gathering his crutches and head to his room. WALTER, JR. Okay. A 1971 Mach 1 fastback in Grabber Lime... with a shaker hood... ‘Stang.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: I’ll write that down so we don’t forget. (fake-pats his chest) A darn. No pencil. Mom and Dad smile as their son exits... but then they mak eye contact with each other. Walt’s here for other busine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching in a pocket of his own nearby jacket, Walt offer Skyler a plain white, unmarked ENVELOPE (unsealed). Skyle nervously nods thanks. Here’s the moment of truth. She opens the envelope and slides out a CASHIER'S CHECK ( won't see the amount, but just in case, it’s $10,000). Skyler examines the check a moment, grateful, but then... curious. Confused. She finally has to break the silence.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: What is “Ice Station Zebra Associates?” Walt wasn’t expecting questions, so he’s a little thrown. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 17.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: It’s a loan-out. It’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Whose loan-out?

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: It’s fine. Really. I have a guy. Hmm. Skyler’s radar is now WAY up.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Ohhh-kay... um, does your “guy” know the tax code and regulations for New Mexico? Cause, there’s very specific paperwork that has to be submitted quarterly on this.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: (nodding; absolutely!) Yes. My guy is a TOP guy...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Who is he? What’s his name? What are his qualifications? Walt, this... (lowers her voice) «+. money has to be unimpeachable when it reaches Hank and Marie.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: And it is. It will be.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: But, how do I know that? I mean, apparently you can’t even tell me the man’s name. Exasperated, Walt thinks he can call her bluff.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Jesus, Skyler. You really want to know? I mean, d’you you really want to know?! Really? Big mistake. Off Skyler’s resolute face -- Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 18. INT. SAUL’S OFFICE - LOBBY - DAY In a snazzy ONE-ER, we PAN ACROSS a thicket of gang-bange cheats and troglodytes who are waiting for the legal serv of Mr. Saul Goodman, Esq. to find... .»». Walt and Skyler. Skyler is in a slight state of shoc even she didn’t expect it to be this bad. Off Walt, watch her closely out of the corner of his eye... realizing a b too late that this is probably a HUGE mistake... INT. SAUL’S OFFICE - DAY - LATER CLOSE ON Saul’s “University of American Samoa” diploma. Skyler stands staring at it, deadpan and unimpressed. Beh her we find SAUL GOODMAN, definitely impressed (and sligh flummoxed) to be meeting pretty Skyler.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Hell. Welcome. What a pleasure it is to have you! I’m just gonna call you Skyler, if that’s okay. It’s a lovely name. Reminds me of a... big beautiful sky. Walt never told me lucky how lucky he was... prior to recent unfortunate events. Walt watches nervously as his two worlds collide -- Saul fawning over the tall-drink-of-water that is Skyler, and Skyler uneasy that she might accidentally pick up a socia disease from the charged and shifty shyster that is Saul.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Clearly his taste in women is the same as his taste in lawyers: only very best with just the right amount of dirty. (laughs; off her stare) That’s a joke. That’s a joke. It’s funny because you are so clearly very classy. Here, please, sit down. Saul pulls out a chair for her. When she’s not looking, S gives a quick eyebrow-raise of approval to Walt for landi such a looker. Walt tries not to notice, taking his own s as Saul rounds to the business side of his desk.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: So. Walt tells me that you have, uh, some concerns I can alleviate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 19.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Skyler scans the big “Constitution wall” behind Saul..

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Uh, yes I do. I have... concerns. No shit. Glancing sidelong at Walt, you don’t have to be Kreskin to read her mind. How the fuck did you end up wit THIS guy? Yet Skyler politely presses forward...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Um, if we’re going to go down this road... and clearly we are, for the sake of my brother-in-law...

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: I’ve heard about him. Uh, he’s an American hero. Nodding, Saul gives out with the cheesy sympathy like a discount undertaker. Skyler pauses flatly, then continues

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: At any rate, I need some assurances that we’re gonna go about this ina manner that is extremely safe and cautious.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Fair enough. I'’11 walk you through the process. First step is something we like to call “money laundering.” Alright, take you’re money were represented by say... these jelly beans.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Uh, Saul... Saul sets out a jar of jelly beans, meaning to pitch the simplistic “Money Laundering 101” he gave to Jesse in #30 Walt tries to warn Saul with a quick shake of his head.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Y'know, I’m a bookkeeper -- so I actually, I know what money laundering is.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. (takes away jelly beans) Well. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 20.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Really? Crickets.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: And as with most things, the Devil is in the details. So to begin with, what are we saying is the source of this money?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: That's simple. Walt here came up with a great story about gambling winnings. Blackjack, right? Some card-counting system?

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: (quiet discomfort) Um, actually that was Skyler’s idea. Saul’s eyes widen at Skyler, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Well. You grow more gorgeous by the minute! (then; shrugs) Well, there you have it. I/’11 generate false Currency Transaction Reports out the wazoo, as well as the necessary W-2Gs. I know a couple casino managers who will jump at the chance to report false losses. So, win-win for everyone.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: But you can’t sell that for very long --

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (interrupts) Yeah, yeah. Way ahead of you. Uh, we declare just enough so as not to arouse suspicion. Then, Walt’s one- time winnings become seed money for investment.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Investment in what?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Drum roll please... wait for it... (beaming) Laser Tag. Off their non-reaction: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 21.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Laser Tag! Seven thousand square feet of rollicking fun in the heart of northern Bernalillo County! Skyler is stone-faced.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Laser Tag.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Yeah. There’s guns and glo-lites, and kids wear the vests and runa round in teams--

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: (interrupts) Yeah, I actually know what it is. It just that... in relation to Walt, it’s, I mean, it doesn’t make any sense. Walt is a silent, sick observer as these two go at it. Saul’s patience rapidly frays as she questions his method Trying to sound like he’s joking:

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Makes more sense than you two being together! I’m still trying to figure out how that happened...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Do you even know Walt? I mean, how would he, of all people, buy a Laser Tag business? It-it doesn’t add up.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: It adds up perfectly. Walt’s a scientist. Scientists love lasers! Skyler stares at him flatly. The wind leaves Saul’

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Plus, they got bumper boats. So.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: “Hey everybody, Walt suddenly decided to invest in laser tag! Just out of the blue!” Really? That’s what we’re supposed to tell people -- our family, our friends... the government... s sails. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 22.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Okay. Let me bottom line this for you. You don’t need to be involved. Okay? Because I’ve been doing this for a lot of years, successfully -- believe it or not, without your help! (smiles) So. Thank you for stopping by. Saul is done. Skyler stares at him -- they’re at stalemat Off Walt, not wanting to make a move to remind either of that he’s sitting there... EXT. ANDREA’S HOME - DAY Establishing. A small house somewhere in the barrio. INT. ANDREA’S HOME - DAY Andrea's face appears near a lamp in her living room, reaching under to feel for the switch. She clicks off the light, leaving only the sun sneaking through the drawn curtains. Andrea plops on the couch next to... Jesse. And the two start making out. Damn, our boy works fast -- he is in! As Jesse starts moving a little too fas unbuttoning her shirt...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: You want a beer or somethin’?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Or somethin’? What do you mean? Jesse kisses her neck as she laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Like beer. I’m cleaned out of anything else. Even if I wasn’t, we're not supposed to.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’ve heard it... over and over and over again. Y'know, don’t you think it’s ridiculous that society says beer is okay, anda little hit of something... sweet is wrong? She keeps gently kissing him, but he keeps selling... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 23.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I mean, mhat’s the point of shutting yourself off completely from something that... lifts you off the ground? I spend so much energy fighting the urge not to use, and I feel like crap ‘cause of it...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: I know. It’s just...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: I can’t get caught using again. Jesse looks her in the eyes. Something painful behind the For a moment, it seems as if Jesse is going to soften... Maybe it's not easy to do this, like the guys said. Then:

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: The thing is... not to get caught. (then) You ever try that blue stuff that’s going around? Just a little gas in the tank and... suddenly everything is interesting. (half to himself) Man. I wish I could make that feeling last. Jesse is smooth in his seduction... and evil... as he bui up the desire for meth, tempting Andrea with each word.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Like I said. I got nothing here. Jesse nods, waiting for the right moment to say...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What if I could get some? Andrea seems open to it. Yes. What if? But before Jesse can close the deal... The front door OPENS. A FIVE-YEAR OLD BOY runs in, follow by Andrea’s GRANDMA (50s), who carries two bags of grocer

dialogues.speaker: BROCK
dialogues.text: Mommy! Mommy! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 24.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse and Andrea quickly compose themselves as the boy, Andrea’s son BROCK, runs to her.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Hey, baby. Your nana brought you home early. (to grandma) Grandma, I thought you were keeping Brock today? Grandma eyes Jesse, not too pleased.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: I was, then I saw your car. I thought you had a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: I did, but we changed the time. (points to Jesse) Grandma, this is Jesse. He’s from the meeting. He’s like a sponsor. Jesse, this is Grandma. Jesse gives a half-hearted, uncomfortable nod and wave. Grandma sets down the groceries and leaves, muttering disparaging words in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) I'm tired... tired of you all. SLAM goes the door. Jesse adjusts in his seat to see... Brock at the edge of the couch, staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: (feeling awkward now) Jesse, this is Brock. Andrea gathers the groceries and carries them into the adjacent kitchen, putting them away. Brock, a cute kid, keeps staring at Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (to Andrea) So... you, uh, you have a kid, huh? She nods. Jesse and the boy stare at each other a moment, and a softer side of Jesse, the old Jesse, seems to come

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: ‘Sup? Brock, huh. That’s a cool name. Here. Give it up... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 25.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He holds out his fist to Brock, who takes a brief moment. but then gives Jesse the “fist bump” that he was waiting This really amuses Jesse, who we haven’t seen smile this in a long time. We can tell the kid likes Jesse, too.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Brock is almost six. You okay? With kids?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What? Yeah, yeah... He’s cool. Brock smiles. He likes being cool. Stepping back amongst them, Andrea takes Brock by the hand and guides him away.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Okay, Brock is gonna go play in his room while the big people talk. He’s gonna go play with his Legos, and his cars... Say “Bye, Jesse.”

dialogues.speaker: BROCK
dialogues.text: Bye, Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: You have a good time at Grandma’s..? Oh, I fixed your blue car, remember... the convertible one? Play with your toys... Jesse gives the kid a smile and a wave. As Jesse is left alone, he rises, looks around. Maybe wondering what the h he’s doing here. Thoughts run through his head... about h own brother? About the red-haired boy from Episode #206?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skyler is behind the wheel, stewing. She and Walt are com from their disastrous Saul powwow. Silence, until...

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Safe and cautious, that’s all I’m asking -- and that man is neither. Walt sighs.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: I‘'ll admit he comes across like a circus clown... but he actually knows what he'd doing. (adding) And “safe and cautious” is you not being involved in this at all. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 26.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Well, it’s a little late on that. This is what happens when you decide to pay our bills with drug money. Walt considers her. Screw it -- he makes a big confession

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Skyler, this isn’t just about what happened before. My involvement in this is... ongoing. (stresses) Understand? Walt hasn’t said this out loud to Skyler before, but make crystal clear: he is still manufacturing. Skyler doesn’t really react. She knew already. How could she not?

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: I can’t just quit. I have a... something of a contract. (off her glance) It’s all very safe and professional. Structured. But I can’t simply quit. Heavy stuff. What’s Sky gonna say to all of that? Nothing so far. She’s inscrutably silent. At a stop sign, she put on her blinker -- CLICK CLICK. CLICK CLICK. Walt is a little confused as she makes a turn.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Where you going? But she speeds away in silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big, empty parking lot at an old strip mall or somesuch Out of the distance appears the old Jeep, motoring toward It pulls to a stop in f.g., Skyler and Walt staring out t windshield past us. Walt knows where he is -- he just doesn’t know why he’s h We don’t see what he and Skyler are studying.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: If you're gonna launder money Walt, at least do it right. Skyler climbs out. After a beat, Walt joins her to look a  BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are parked across from a CAR WASH. But not just any wash. It’s where Walt worked all the way back in the PILO

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: You worked here four years. It’s a business you understand. It’s a story people will believe. Not Laser Tag. This. This is what we buy. Walt looks at her... what we buy?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: You. This is what you buy. She corrects herself without urging, but still... Skyler at a level of acceptance Walt would have never dreamed co happen. Off Walt, eyeing this possible business venture, an uneasy new stage in their relationship...

dialogues.speaker: END ACT TWO
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NEW DAY from the end of Act Two -- new wardrobe. Jesse leans against a wall, having a post-meeting cigarette. Several other GROUP MEMBERS mill about, doing the same. Here comes Skinny Pete and Badger, exiting the meeting, Badger still munching on a big doughnut. The guys approac a little wary to see Jesse -- did he make his sale? Automatically dropping into “We don’t know each other” mo

dialogues.speaker: BADGER
dialogues.text: Hey, uh... (snaps; “remembering” ) «+. Jesse, right? (presenting himself) Brandon... Peter. How goes it? Hanging in there? Jesse sighs and shakes his head, tiredly exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Please, just..? Dumbass.

dialogues.speaker: BADGER
dialogues.text: Sorry, man. Just trying to keep it on the D.L.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY PETE
dialogues.text: (glances around; hesitant) So. You and that girl. You do the deed yet?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY PETE
dialogues.text: You know. Sell to her? He says it low. Jesse remains cool, shakes his head. Jesse realizes -- they think he didn’t have the balls to through with slinging meth to Andrea. Irritated:

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What are you two even doing here? --

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY PETE
dialogues.text: What d’ya mean? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 29.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You can’t get your nut up to sell, what’s the point of even coming? Pete and Badger share another look -- isn't it obvious?

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY PETE
dialogues.text: Homie, I’m on, like, Step Five -- This is totally sincere -- Skinny’s really trying to do t right thing here. Jesse stares at him, open-mouthed. Then he looks to Badger -- and you? Badger throws two fingers in what looks like a gang sign but what he’s really saying is that he’s at STEP TWO.

dialogues.speaker: BADGER
dialogues.text: Deuce, yo. I’m catching up. Off of Jesse’s disbelief, he spies... Andrea, emerging fr the church, scanning for Jesse. He stubs out his cig, mak a bee-line for her.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Whatever. Later. Badger and Pete stare after Jesse as he catches up with Andrea. The boyz both watch as they slip casually into ea other’s arms and head off together.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY PETE
dialogues.text: Dude needs to come into the fold.

dialogues.speaker: BADGER
dialogues.text: Yep. Badger and Pete nod, sad for Jesse and his evil ways. INT. TACO SAL’S - NIGHT Jesse, Andrea and young Brock are seated at a booth in th mom & pop eatery. Clearly, Jesse’s not following through his meth-selling. Instead... the trio are having a nice family-type dinner.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Hey, you know what? I have magical powers. You wanna see? Ready? Jesse does a small hand trick. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 30.

dialogues.speaker: BROCK
dialogues.text: That’s not real.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It is real. Alright, D’you want to see something that’s real? Look at this. Watch this. Ready? Jesse crunches down the PAPER WRAPPING off a straw into a small wad. Jesse makes sure Brock is watching, and he is. He’s fascinated with Jesse. Andrea watches him too, a lit wistful... maybe wondering if this is the guy who might b around for her son... but it’s way too early to tell. Jesse loads the straw with some water out of a cup (cappi his thumb over one side to trap the water in). He drips s drops onto the paper wad, and... The paper slowly EXPANDS like a worm. Brock smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You like that? That’s science and stuff, makes it do that.

dialogues.speaker: BROCK
dialogues.text: Do it again. Jesse smiles, wanting to please, but Andrea chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Let Jesse eat his dinner, Brock.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It’s okay... It’s okay. Wanna see it again? Andrea smiles at Jesse, having to be the mom.

dialogues.speaker: BROCK
dialogues.text: Can you do a trick with firecrackers?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Firecrackers? Um, you know, I have any firecrackers on me. Who does a trick with firecrackers?

dialogues.speaker: BROCK
dialogues.text: Tomas. Hearing this name, Andrea grows a bit uncomfortable. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 31.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Tomas does tricks with firecrackers, huh. Who’s Tomas? Andrea tries not to make a big deal out of it.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: He’s my kid brother...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: (lower) And... we don’t talk about him. Andrea returns to her meal. Jesse doesn’t press her -- it her business, after all. But he can’t help but be curious

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Come on... Eat your food, Brock.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Can I have your chip? I’m gonna steal your chip.

dialogues.speaker: BROCK
dialogues.text: Hey, that’s mine! As this pleasant dinner continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a “LAWYRUP” license plate. We RISE UP off it (it the rear plate, of course -- no front plates in The Land Enchantment) until we’re looking through the rear window parked CADILLAC. The backs of two men’s heads are visible within. The men stare out at the familiar CAR WASH in b.g

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: That's it? That’s what you wanna buy? NEW ANGLE -- the Caddy is Saul’s, of course. And here he behind the wheel, Walt seated beside him. The wary look in his eyes tells us Saul isn’t loving the idea. For his part, Walt probably isn’t doing the world’s greatest job selling it -- this is Skyler’s plan, after a However, being a good devil’s advocate, Walt shrugs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 32.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: People will believe it, at least. I worked here four years. Saul frowns, raises an eyebrow. Sounds sad.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: “Wax-on, wax-off” -- was that you? (then) Hey, how come you guys always give with the air freshener? I explicitly say I want no air freshener and every time I drive away smelling like an Alpine whorehouse. Walt’s not listening. His attention is elsewhere. Walt’s POV -- a bushy-eyebrowed MAN stands in the wipe-do area, berating an employee (we can’t hear what he’s sayin Fans will recognize him as BOGDAN, Walt’s former boss. Walt’s attitude here is hard to gauge. Sure he despised t man and this place... but is there a certain nostalgia in eyes, a yearning for simpler times?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: All due respect, I don’t see it. So, I vote, I vote no.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: It makes a better story than your Laser Tag...

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Is that you talking... or Yoko Ono?

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: (stifles his annoyance) She has a point. It makes more sense that I invest right here.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Based on her years of experience in money laundering, I suppose. (before Walt can argue) Lemme tell you something -- if you’re committed enough, you can make any story work. I once convinced a woman that I was Kevin Costner, and it worked because I believed it. Alright? It has nothing to do with the story! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 33.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Saul points out the window at the car wash.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Besides, this dump isn’t gonna work because it doesn’t have a Danny. Okay? There’s no Danny here!

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: What in god’s name is a Danny?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Danny runs the Laser Tag. Danny is the guy who had a vision. Where others saw a dirt lot, he saw black lights, rubber aliens, teenagers running around with ray guns, right? He was like Bugsy Siegel in the desert. And when the stock market took a shit and Danny got in trouble, he went searching for exactly the type of situation that we're offering. Okay, Danny will look the other way to keep his dream afloat. In other words, Danny can be trusted. Completely. (points to Bogdan) That guy? The guy with the, uh, the eyebrows-that-won'’t-quit? Is he a Danny? Walt looks to Bogdan again. The answer is clearly no.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: You buy this place, all you got is a big building that squirts water. You got no Danny here. As Walt absorbs this, and Saul starts the engine... INT. ANDREA’S BEDROOM - DAY - LATER CLOSE ON a cigarette getting stubbed out in an ashtray. I Andrea, reaching across Jesse to get to the end table. It's afterwards. She and Jesse are naked in bed (of cours this will be handled discreetly), as she lays her head do on his chest. Jesse smokes his own cigarette, propped up a few pillows. Quiet. Maybe even wistful. Is he thinking of Jane? After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: You wanna stay for dinner? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 34.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thanks. (then) What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: (squints at clock) Early still. Both are quiet again. Andrea looks up at Jesse. She seems wistful, too. Pining not for someone... for something.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: So... Jesse misreads her -- smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Thought... maybe if you're holdin’... we can do somethin’.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: .~.. what?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: (sheepish) You know. That blue stuff you were talking about. Maybe you had a line on some? Jesse sits up, practically knocking her off his body a little. He mashes his cigarette in the ashtray, incensed.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Wait, whoa... what? You said the kid is coming home...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Yeah, in a few hours.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: And you seriously wanna get high?!

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: (taken aback; a beat) I don’t know what you're getting so pissed about. You’re the one who brought it up the other day... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 35.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Yeah. That was before I found out you got a kid. What kind of mother are you? That really hits Andrea hard.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You heard me. What kinda mom gets wasted with a little kid to take care of? She rises, not caring she’s naked (discreet glimpses only

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Nobody can say I don’t take care of my son. Jesse feels a touch of regret. But she’s on a tear now.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: You gonna come in my house and judge me? Like you got no responsibilities, so it’s okay for you to get high?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Look, I...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: What do you know about me? I take care of my baby. I’11 do anything for him. The day Brock was born, I swore... Andrea trails off abruptly, feeling like she’s shared too much -- and with a guy she’s suddenly none too sure about Glancing at him, she quietly -- and a bit self-consciousl completes the thought.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: I won’t let what happened to Tomas happen to my son. I’11 die first. She's near tears now. Jesse feels bad for provoking this.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Sorry. I-I just... (half-heartedly) Look, I’11-I'11 get outta here if you want. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 36.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Andrea grabs another cigarette and lights up.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: That’s what you wanna do, then go. There’s an awkward beat -- neither one of them wants to b alone, but they’re too proud to admit it. Until...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It’s not what I want. (then) Look... I was outta line... talkin’ about that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: (considers; very quiet) We both were. Jesse settles back. He’s going to stay. Andrea is quietly relieved that he is.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You're right. I don’t know what you've been through... (then) You can tell me if you want. Andrea considers, takes a drag. Then:

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: This whole neighborhood's run by gangs. They run the drugs, control the streets. They sorta took Tomas in. No Dad around... (ouch) Eight years old, they Tomas slinging. Part of some crew. Then... when he was ten, for some initiation or somethin’... (glancing briefly at him) They made him kill somebody. Jesse is silent. It’s so horrible, there’s nothing to say

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: I heard the rumors. Didn’t believe it at first. But then I saw him like a week later. And he told me, yeah, he did it. They gave Tomas a gun. Gave him a choice. Him or some dude. So he did it. Told me all about it like it was nothing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 37.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Who'd he say he killed?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Some dealer. From some outside crew. Right around the corner from here, over off of Central. Just rode up on his bike and shot him. Jesse blinks. It’s a horrible story, but now... something it piques his interest. Hiding it, his voice even:

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Off of Central. Like, over by the train tracks..? (she shrugs, nods; maybe) When was this?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: Few months back. Jesse lets it sink in. Uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What else did he tell you?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: He shot the guy right through the neck. Shot him dead. Just ‘cause he was working the wrong corner. Andrea tells it matter-of-factly. It’s heartbreaking, but she’s been over it so many times in her head, it’s numbin her now. Jesse, however, is focused on something else. A dealer shot in the neck a few months ago. Jesse puts th pieces together -- was it Andrea’s brother who killed our COMBO?! (Ep. #211)

dialogues.speaker: ANDREA
dialogues.text: It won't happen again. Not to my son. Jesse hardly hears her now, his mind reeling with questio Is it possible he’s found Combo’s killer? And if so... wh is he going to do about it?

dialogues.speaker: END ACT THREE
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 38.

dialogues.speaker: ACT FOUR
dialogues.text: INT. HOSPITAL - HANK’S ROOM - DAY JELL-O quivers on a hospital tray. Untouched. Who can resist Jell-o? WE ARM AROUND to reveal... HANK. He stares down at the Jell-o like it’s a lump of do shit. Obviously, this means more to him than a mere snack Jell-o is what sick people eat. Marie enters the room like a PURPLE ray of SUNSHINE. Tryi to momentarily contain good tidings...

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Guess what? She stands beaming down at him expectantly. After a beat, speaks up, deadpan and sour.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: People who say “guess what,” and then actually expect you to guess? I hate those people. She cocks her head, not about to let him rain on her para

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Well, I just heard about a certain patient... named Schrader-comma-— Hank... (enjoying this) «+. Who is going to be released at the end of this week! She’s tickled beyond belief... until she sees the stolid in Hank’s eyes. Chiding him gently:

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Isn’t that fantastic? He lets out a derisive snort -- not so much, no.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: They planning on rolling me out the front door, at least? Or put me on a greased plank and, uh, slide me out the window?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Hey... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 39.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: (off her confusion) I don’t care what any damned insurance company thinks -- I’m not leaving here till I’m well.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Hank, this isn’t about the insurance. I’ve talked to everybody -- and they all say that you are healthy enough to go home.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: (bitter sarcasm) Oh, I’m “healthy enough,” huh? Yeah. .?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Hank. You get stronger every day. You don’t need to be in a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: In this condition, yeah. I do. Mama Marie shakes her head -- uh-uh. Reassuring him:

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: You'll be just as comfortable at home as you are here. You’1ll have all the same equipment. Wrong thing to say. His eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: “All the same equipment?” What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: The... equipment. That you have here, that you need. Short-term. You'll do your p.t. at home, and it’ll be great. Because you’1l be home. Hank listens, shaking his head, his frustration building. Marie, wonderfully supportive as she is, is unfortunately only digging this hole deeper, despite her best efforts.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Wait till you see the bedroom. I had ‘em move the plasma in. I know that’s how you always wanted it -- you only had to get shot to get it, right? I got you a new bed... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 40.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: A hospital bed.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: You put a hospital bed in my bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: (hearing his anger) Hank... you’ll be home. Hank can’t hold it any longer. It’s a complete affront to his manhood. He’d bellow if he could, but it would hurt t much and he doesn’t have the strength, besides. So, altho his voice isn’t particularly loud, it overflows with RAGE

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: You get that out of my house. You hear me, Marie? Today. Marie looks at him, mystified, troubled and hurt. Why wou he not want to be back at home?

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Hank --

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: I leave this hospital -- when I WALK outta here. You understand?! And not before. He turns his face away from her, too angry to even look a her now. Off Marie, not sure how to handle this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walt and Skyler sit in the living room, their body langua indicating Walt is still more of a tolerated guest than a partner. Mid-private-chat:

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Wh-what’s a “Danny?” Walt does his best to explain -- sotto so Walt, Jr. (who presumably home) doesn’t hear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 41.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Danny’s an accomplice. Someone who’s in on the scheme, who knows about the laundering. Who's paid to look the other way. Skyler considers, nods. Makes sense. Walt presses on.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: And, while I agree with you that Laser Tag is a hard sell, without a Danny, the car wash isn’t really an option.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: And he can’t get you another Danny to run the car wash.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: (shrugs; no) Easier said than done. If we’re looking for someone trustworthy..? They sit here a beat. It’s settled. Laser Tag, it is. But for Skyler... no, it’s not. This is the last thing sh wants to offer, but for the sake of keeping them safe:

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: What about me? Walt is not sure he heard her right.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Me. I’11 be the Danny. Walt, appropriately, freaks.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Skyler! That is not a good idea --

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: I'm perfectly capable of managing a small business --

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: A legal business! Not this!

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Who else would we trust? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 42.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Walt, I’m in this, and if I’m in it, I’m gonna do it right.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: You are not in this! You are NoT... IN this!

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: We're married. How am I not in this?

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: We are not married, Skyler, we're divorced! (then; peering at her) Right..?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: (a bit sheepish now) I never actually got around to filing the papers. Walt is stunned. And god knows, Skyler is NOT sitting her saying she WANTS to be married to Walt -- not at all. Tru she’s got something else on her mind. Something imminentl practical. Quietly, gravely:

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Married couples can’t be compelled to testify against one another. So there’s that. OFF Walt, head spinning, seeing Skyler in a new light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another day’s cooking. Walt and Jesse quietly go about th business, Jesse prepping one of the large stainless TANKS venting, Walt testing ph levels on some vials. Both are deep in thought, much on their minds, but Jesse particularly lost with all that he’s heard. As Jesse works a lever (or whatever is at hand, and makes sense), Walt slips his mask on, knowing noxious fumes are about to be vented. He notices Jesse doesn’t do the same.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Jesse... Jesse. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 43.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse stops, looks to him. What?

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Your respirator. Jesse realizes his mistake. A dangerous mistake. But with his head mired in thought, Jesse doesn’t stop to thank Wa or react to the error. He just nods.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Right. Walt eyes his partner -- you okay? Before he can probe Je further... RING. A loud industrial PHONE BELL goes off. Walt and Jesse share a look -- never heard that before. RING... RING. They slip off their masks, looking around. Focusing on the wall-mounted PHONE. RING. Walt is particularly nervous, already paranoid about being listen to -- who could be calling?? His nervousness is infectious -- Jesse, too, looks a bit freaked. RING. They share another look -- guess we should answer it. Walt finally does.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: s+. yes? We don’t hear who he’s talking to... but from his attitud must be someone important. Jesse grows more curious.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Uh... yes. Okay... okay. I’11 be there. Finally, Walt hangs up. Ponders this call.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: An invitation. Invitation to what? Off this mystery, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOOR. A flat composition, recalling the Georgia O'Keeff painting that started the episode. Then... WALT steps int the shot, his back to us. WIDE. We see Walt in front of a neatly kept home in a nic upper-middle-class suburban neighborhood. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 44,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His Aztek parked out front. We realize this is the site o the mysterious invitation... but whose house is it? Walt knows -- and seems quite wary. He steps to the door KNOCK-KNOCK... Walt waits. We hear approaching FOOTSTEPS... the door UNLOCKS. It swings open to reveal... GUS FRING. Restaurateur. Meth kingpin. The man Walt now knows was behind the shooting of Hank. Gus smiles, wiping his hands on a dish towel as he greets Walt, looking ever bit the kindly homeowner.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Ah, Walter. You’re right on time. Please... come in. Walt gives a polite yet hesitant nod as he steps into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walt glances around as he steps through the door -- it lo normal enough. No armed thugs, no Scarface-type decoratio It looks like... a home. Gus shuts the door and faces Walt. Walt doesn’t know what he’s in for -- did Gus find out about Jesse stealing? Wil he be taken to task? Is this the end of Walter White? Then...

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I hope you like Paila Marina... Gus walks off. Walt stands a frozen beat. As he follows..

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: It’s a fancy name for fish stew. It sounds like a cliche, but indeed, it’s just like my mother used to make. Moving with subtle caution, Walt follows after his host, taking in the sights of Gus’s inner sanctum. Looking arou it’s... tasteful, modest... god, it’s... normal. Shocking normal. Cozy even. As Walt moves, he sees... On the floor of the living room, there’s one or two children’s TOYS (generic -- like a plastic riding toy or dolls, whatever we can get). Some of the cabinets and shelves may have family photos, but we never want to get close enough to see any details of faces (in case we want cast these roles in later episodes). (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 45.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There’s no sign of any other family members here currentl but the home certainly feels lived in. Can we be sure thi home is actually Gus’... who knows?

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Come on. You can help me cook. Walt continues through the place, into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus washes vegetables at the sink as Walt enters this wel appointed kitchen. High-end pots and pans -- someone who loves to cook lives here. Dinner is halfway prepared.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: This is a Chilean dish that I love, but... I never get to make it. Kids won’t eat it. But, uh... You know how that is. Expecting trouble around every corner, Walt is surprised not finding any. Nodding distractedly...

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Sure. Gus leaves the sink and reaches for a large and very shar CHEF’S KNIFE.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Do you mind...? He surprises Walt by HANDING him the blade, handle-first.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Wwould you slice the garlic? Very thin. Walt examines the blade in his hand. He can SEE HIMSELF reflected in the shiny stainless. Walt looks up from the knife, considers Gus... who has tu his back to attend to some shallots frying on the stove. It'd be so easy for Walt to plunge this knife into Gus. I this a test? Gus giving him the opportunity for vengeance see what he will do? Or is this some twisted show of trus Walt has to know -- and asks a simple question. Carefully keeping his voice even, not sounding too suspicious:

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Why did you invite me here? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 46.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gus gets that Walt is wary. No sense pretending he doesn’ Doing his best to put him at ease, he gives Walt a faint yet somewhat warm -- smile.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: We're working together... why not break bread together? Walt considers. Nods. Sounds... legit. Gus, still smiling

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Now... the garlic? Walt again glances at the knife in his hand and the garli before him. Off him slicing it thin, just as he was told:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour later. Over their jointly prepared meal (which lo quite good, Gus is no slouch in the kitchen!), Walt is st on-guard, but less so. He knows Gus is a master chess player. But is there a move here? And what is it? While they eat...

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: It always amazes me... the way the senses work in connection to memory. (re: his plate) This stew is simply an amalgam of ingredients. Taken separately, these ingredients alone don’t remind me of anything. Not very much at all. But in this precise combination? The smell of this meal..? Instantly, it brings me back to my childhood. How is that possible?

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: (almost sheepish) Basically it all takes place in the hippocampus. Neural connections are formed. The senses make the neurons express signals that go right back to the same part of the brain as before. Where memory is stored. It’s, um, something called relational memory... (then) Don’t quote me on that. I-I’m rusty on my biology. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 47.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gus is pleased to finally have Walt part of the conversat

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: That's very interesting. He probably really means this. Walt nods... but he still can’t be comfortable. What the fuck is this meal about?! Sensing his discomfort...

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Walter. I would like to help you, if I could.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Help me how?

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Well, when I first started out, I made a lot of mistakes. More than I care to admit. I wish I’d had someone to advise me. Because this life of ours... it can overwhelm. (a beat) You're a wealthy man now. And one must learn to be rich. (smiles faintly) To be poor? Anyone can manage. Gus sips his wine. Walt studies him.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: What advice do you have for me? Gus considers. Then, nodding to himself, satisfied that h come up with a good one, he declares:

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Never make the same mistake twice. Said simply... delivered in a totally casual, friendly manner... and yet what does it mean? Walt nods. Fair enough. But he can’t shake the idea that there’s something more to this. That maybe it’s a warning Off Walt and Gus, eating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don’t know where we are at first. Just some shitty, lesser-traveled part of ABQ. No place familiar, far as we can see. Into this frame drives... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 48.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ... Jesse’s TERCEL, slowing to a stop before us. Parking. Jesse looks out past us through his windshield. He climbs out, taking his time, surveying the area. Then, he casual makes his way across the street. At which point we REVERSE, revealing (at least for those viewers with a good memory for such things) the STREETCOR on which poor Combo was murdered. And there, in the distance, a young Hispanic kid hangs ou tooling around in slow, aimless circles on his BMX bike. Jesse walks toward him, not too fast, hands in his pocket We may recognize this kid from Ep. #211 as COMBO’S KILLER A touch older, a little harder... this is TOMAS, Andrea’s little brother.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Hey. The kid eyes him, putting on his best gangsta airs.

dialogues.speaker: TOMAS
dialogues.text: Wassup?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You, uh, you Tomas? (off his non-answer) I heard you were the man.

dialogues.speaker: TOMAS
dialogues.text: Yeah? What you want? Jesse, playing a part, shoots a quick, nervous glance aro the neighborhood, keeping his eyes peeled for cops.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Um, crystal. You think you could hook me up? Tomas looks him over. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: TOMAS
dialogues.text: Three hundred.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: For a teenth? Shit, c’mon, yo.

dialogues.speaker: TOMAS
dialogues.text: Three hundred. Jesse looks around. Ahh, fuck it. He exposes a wad of BIL from his pocket -- Tomas slows him with a hand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKING BAD #311 "Abiquiu" AS BROADCAST 49.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Put that away, man! Jesse is clearly playing this as if h were a naive white guy buying drugs in the barrio. Tomas now NODS to a distant, familiar CAR parked around a corner. Which noses into view. It slowly motors our way. It pulls up alongside Jesse, who does his best to look nervous (alright, maybe it’s not all an act). Inside the muscle car are two familiar BULLETHEADS -- the dealers wh ordered Tomas to kill Combo.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Hey, ‘sup. One of the Bulletheads shuts him down with a LOOK. Then t thug gives a quick “hand it over” flick-flick of his fing Jesse nods, counts out two hundred and hands it over. The guy takes it, counts, glances to Tomas... and then th two Bulletheads drive off. They round right back to their opposite corner, the one they were parked on originally. Jesse blinks -- where's my dope, yo?!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Hey! Yo! Jesse glances back at Tomas behind him... who unceremonio shoves a TEENTH BAGGIE in Jesse’s hand. This is the set-u apparently: the two Bulletheads hold the money while the underage kid holds the METH. If he gets busted, he’s only minor, while the two hardass creeps in the car likely ska His purchase gripped in hand, Jesse hesitates, staring do at young Tomas. The kid frowns up at him.

dialogues.speaker: TOMAS
dialogues.text: Bounce. Jesse does as he’s told -- for the moment. He turns and walks back toward his parked Tercel. We PULL Jesse along, letting Tomas recede deeper and deep into b.g. As we stay here on Jesse, Steadicamming him along... ... His expression DARKENS. To a cold place we’ve never quite seen before. As we desperately wonder what our Jess is thinking... and planning...
